abstract: In New York to promote a new book about him, Warren E. Buffett lamented Wall Street, which promotes a trading culture over an investing culture.
snippet: In New York to promote a new book about him, Warren E. Buffett lamented Wall Street, which promotes a trading culture over an investing culture.
lead_paragraph: “If somebody bought Berkshire Hathaway in 1965 and they held it, they made a great investment — and their broker would have starved to death.”

headline.main: For Buffett, the Long Run Still Trumps the Quick Return
headline.print_headline: For Buffett, Long View Still Trumps Quick Return
